source.name: Birmingham City Council
source.notes: Based on official Birmingham City Council recycling bin guidelines. Unique pod system: removable paper/card pod + main bin for plastic/metal/glass. Tetra Paks NOT accepted. Black food trays NOT accepted.

materials.name: Cardboard boxes
instructions: Place in the recycling bin pod (paper/card section)
Large boxes can be placed next to the bin or in a separate cardboard box
notes: The pod is the removable section inside the recycling bin lid for paper and card
commonMistakes: Don't include boxes soiled with food or grease
Don't leave packing materials inside

materials.name: Cardboard packaging
notes: Includes sleeves, inserts, and flat card packaging
commonMistakes: Don't include wax-coated card
Don't include greasy or food-soiled card

materials.name: Newspapers
instructions: Place in recycling bin pod (paper/card section)
notes: Keep dry
commonMistakes: Don't include if wet or heavily soiled

materials.name: Magazines and catalogues
notes: Glossy paper is fine
commonMistakes: Don't include the plastic wrapper — bin it

materials.name: Envelopes
notes: Windowed envelopes are accepted
commonMistakes: Don't include padded or bubble-lined envelopes — those go in general waste

materials.name: Junk mail and leaflets
notes: Includes glossy and non-glossy leaflets
commonMistakes: Don't include if heavily laminated

materials.name: Cereal boxes
instructions: Remove the inner plastic bag (general waste)
notes: Inner plastic liner goes in general waste
commonMistakes: Don't include the inner plastic bag

materials.name: Writing and printing paper
notes: Staples are fine
commonMistakes: Don't include shredded paper — use general waste

materials.name: Wrapping paper (non-metallic)
instructions: Scrunch test: if it stays scrunched, it can be recycled
notes: Foil or glittery wrapping paper goes in general waste
commonMistakes: Don't include metallic or glittery wrapping paper

materials.name: Phone books and directories
instructions: Place in recycling bin pod or next to the bin
notes: Can go in whole

materials.name: Greeting cards
notes: Cards with glitter still attached go in general waste
commonMistakes: Don't include glittery cards without removing glitter
Don't include musical cards

materials.name: Cardboard egg boxes
notes: Cardboard only — not plastic or polystyrene
commonMistakes: Don't include polystyrene egg boxes

materials.name: Toilet and kitchen roll tubes
instructions: Flatten and place in recycling bin pod
notes: Easy to recycle
commonMistakes: Don't include paper towels — those go in general waste

materials.name: Paper bags
notes: Remove plastic handles if present
commonMistakes: Don't include wax-coated paper bags

materials.name: Shoeboxes
instructions: Flatten and place in recycling bin pod or next to the bin
notes: Remove tissue paper or plastic inserts
commonMistakes: Don't include plastic or foam inserts

materials.name: Plastic drink bottles
instructions: Remove the lid (recycle lid separately in the main bin)
Place bottle in main section of recycling bin
notes: Birmingham asks you to REMOVE lids from drink bottles
Main bin section is for plastics, metals, and glass
commonMistakes: Don't leave lids on — Birmingham requires lids removed

materials.name: Plastic pots, tubs, and trays (not black)
instructions: Place in main section of recycling bin
notes: Black plastic trays are NOT accepted
commonMistakes: Don't include black plastic trays — they go in general waste
Don't include polystyrene trays

materials.name: Household and toiletry bottles
instructions: Place in main section of recycling bin
notes: Birmingham asks you to remove lids from all bottles
commonMistakes: Don't leave lids on

materials.name: Plastic milk bottles
instructions: Place in main section of recycling bin
notes: Remove lids — Birmingham requires this
commonMistakes: Don't leave the lid on

materials.name: Yoghurt pots
instructions: Place in main section of recycling bin
notes: Non-black plastic only
commonMistakes: Don't include if black plastic

materials.name: Margarine and butter tubs
instructions: Place in main section of recycling bin
notes: Non-black plastic tubs accepted
commonMistakes: Don't leave thick residue

materials.name: Plastic food containers (not black)
instructions: Place in main section of recycling bin
notes: Must not be black plastic
commonMistakes: Don't include black plastic containers
Don't include polystyrene

materials.name: Plastic lids
instructions: Place loose in main section of recycling bin
notes: Birmingham asks you to remove lids and recycle them separately
commonMistakes: Don't leave lids on bottles or jars

materials.name: Food and drink cans
instructions: Place in main section of recycling bin
notes: All food and drink cans accepted — aluminium and steel
commonMistakes: Don't include paint or chemical tins

materials.name: Clean aluminium foil
instructions: Place in main section of recycling bin
notes: Must be clean — soiled foil goes in general waste
commonMistakes: Don't include heavily food-soiled foil

materials.name: Foil trays
instructions: Place in main section of recycling bin
notes: Must be clean
commonMistakes: Don't include if heavily soiled

materials.name: Aerosol cans
instructions: Place in main section of recycling bin
notes: Birmingham accepts aerosols in the recycling bin
commonMistakes: Don't include cans that still have contents
Don't puncture aerosols

materials.name: Metal lids
instructions: Place loose in main section of recycling bin
notes: Lids should be removed from glass jars and bottles
commonMistakes: Don't leave on jars — remove them

materials.name: Biscuit and sweet tins
instructions: Place in main section of recycling bin
notes: Metal tins are recyclable
commonMistakes: Don't include plastic tray inserts

materials.name: Clear glass bottles
instructions: Place in main section of recycling bin
notes: Clear and coloured glass both accepted
commonMistakes: Don't include broken glass
Don't leave lids on

materials.name: Coloured glass bottles
instructions: Place in main section of recycling bin
notes: Green, brown, and blue glass all accepted
commonMistakes: Don't include broken glass
Don't leave lids on

materials.name: Glass jars
instructions: Remove metal lids (recycle lids separately in main bin)
Place in main section of recycling bin
notes: All colours accepted
commonMistakes: Don't include Pyrex or heat-resistant glass
Don't leave lids on

materials.name: Plastic bags and wrappers
notes: Some supermarkets accept soft plastics at front-of-store collection points
commonMistakes: Don't put in the recycling bin

materials.name: Plastic film and cling film
notes: Not recyclable at kerbside
commonMistakes: Don't put in the recycling bin

materials.name: Polystyrene and styrofoam
notes: Not recyclable at kerbside
commonMistakes: Don't put in the recycling bin

materials.name: Black plastic food trays
notes: Black plastic cannot be detected by sorting equipment
Birmingham specifically does NOT accept black food trays
commonMistakes: Don't put in the recycling bin — sorting machines cannot see black plastic

materials.name: Nappies and sanitary products
notes: Never place in the recycling bin
commonMistakes: Don't put in any recycling bin

materials.name: Food-soiled packaging and greasy pizza boxes
notes: Grease contaminates paper recycling
Tear off clean parts and recycle those in the pod
commonMistakes: Don't put greasy pizza boxes in the recycling pod

materials.name: Paper towels and tissues
notes: Too degraded and contaminated to recycle
commonMistakes: Don't put in the recycling pod

materials.name: Crisp packets and sweet wrappers
notes: Mixed materials — not recyclable at kerbside
commonMistakes: Don't put in the recycling bin

materials.name: Bubble wrap
notes: Not accepted in kerbside recycling
commonMistakes: Don't put in the recycling bin

materials.name: Broken crockery and ceramics
notes: Ceramics contaminate glass recycling
commonMistakes: Don't put in the recycling bin — contaminates glass

materials.name: Drinking glasses, Pyrex, and crystal
notes: Different melting point to bottle glass — contaminates recycling
commonMistakes: Don't put in the recycling bin

materials.name: Mirrors and window glass
instructions: Wrap carefully in newspaper or cardboard
Place in general waste bin or take to HWRC
notes: Different composition to bottle glass
commonMistakes: Don't put in the recycling bin

materials.name: Padded envelopes
notes: Made of mixed materials — not recyclable
commonMistakes: Don't put in the recycling pod — they contain bubble wrap or foam

materials.name: Wet wipes
notes: Most wet wipes contain plastic
commonMistakes: Don't flush — they cause sewer blockages

materials.name: Cotton wool and cotton buds
notes: Not recyclable
commonMistakes: Don't flush cotton buds

materials.name: Food waste
notes: Birmingham does NOT currently have a separate food waste collection
Food waste goes in the general waste bin
commonMistakes: Don't put food waste in the recycling bin

materials.name: Carrier bags and black sacks
instructions: Never use to bag your recycling
notes: Recycling must go in loose — never in bags
commonMistakes: Don't bag your recycling in carrier bags or black sacks

materials.name: Hard plastics (toys, furniture parts)
instructions: Small items in general waste bin
Large items take to household waste recycling centre
notes: Hard rigid plastics (not packaging) are not accepted in kerbside recycling
commonMistakes: Don't put in the recycling bin

materials.name: Corks
notes: Not accepted in Birmingham's kerbside recycling
commonMistakes: Don't put in the recycling bin

materials.name: Milk, juice, and Tetra Pak cartons
notes: Birmingham does NOT accept Tetra Paks or cartons in kerbside recycling
This is different from many other councils
commonMistakes: Don't put in the recycling bin — Birmingham does not accept cartons

materials.name: Metal coat hangers
instructions: Or take to household waste recycling centre for scrap metal
notes: Not accepted in kerbside recycling — they jam machinery
commonMistakes: Don't put in the recycling bin — they tangle in sorting equipment

materials.name: Soiled paper and card
notes: Contaminated paper and card cannot be recycled
commonMistakes: Don't put in the recycling pod

materials.name: Wax paper and greaseproof paper
notes: Wax coating means it cannot be recycled as paper
commonMistakes: Don't put in the recycling pod

materials.name: Batteries
instructions: Take to a battery collection point at supermarkets or council buildings
Never put in any household bin
notes: Batteries cause fires in bin lorries and recycling centres
commonMistakes: Never put in household bins — fire risk

materials.name: Electronics and electricals
instructions: Take to household waste recycling centre
notes: Under WEEE regulations, retailers must accept old items when you buy replacements
commonMistakes: Don't put in any household bin

materials.name: Paint
instructions: Take to household waste recycling centre
Or donate usable paint to Community RePaint
notes: Never pour paint down drains
commonMistakes: Don't put in any bin
Don't pour down drains

materials.name: Light bulbs
instructions: CFL and fluorescent: take to HWRC
LED: take to HWRC or electricals recycling
Incandescent and halogen: general waste bin
notes: CFL bulbs contain mercury
Never put in the glass recycling
commonMistakes: Don't put in the recycling bin
Don't put in the glass section

materials.name: Textiles and clothes
instructions: Donate to charity shops if in good condition
Use textile banks or take to HWRC
Damaged textiles can still be recycled
notes: Even damaged clothes can be recycled into industrial cloths or insulation
commonMistakes: Don't put in any kerbside bin
Don't throw good clothes in general waste

materials.name: Cooking oil
instructions: Take to household waste recycling centre
notes: Never pour down the drain — it causes blockages
commonMistakes: Don't pour down the drain or toilet
Don't put in any bin

materials.name: Motor oil
instructions: Take to household waste recycling centre
Some garages accept used motor oil
notes: Highly polluting — never pour down drains
commonMistakes: Don't pour down drains
Don't put in any bin

recycle: Pod (removable section): all paper and card — newspapers, magazines, cardboard, envelopes, cereal boxes
Main bin: plastic bottles/pots/tubs/trays (not black), household bottles (remove lids)
Main bin: food and drink cans, clean foil and foil trays, aerosols, metal lids
Main bin: clear and coloured glass bottles and jars (remove lids)
Large cardboard items next to the bin or in a cardboard box
trash: Food waste (no separate food waste collection)
Plastic bags, film, cling film, bubble wrap
Polystyrene, black food trays, hard plastics
Tetra Paks and cartons (NOT accepted in recycling)
Nappies, wet wipes, tissues, paper towels
Soiled packaging, wax paper, padded envelopes

recycle: Tetra Pak cartons — Birmingham does NOT accept these
Black plastic food trays — sorting machines cannot detect them
Plastic bags, film, wrappers — jam sorting machinery
Food waste — goes in general waste
Metal items like coat hangers — they tangle machinery
Padded envelopes, soiled paper, wax paper

tips: Birmingham uses a unique POD system: removable pod for paper/card, main bin for plastic/metal/glass
REMOVE lids from all bottles and jars — Birmingham requires this
Tetra Paks and cartons are NOT accepted — put in general waste
Black plastic trays are NOT accepted — sorting machines can't see them
Rinse containers but they don't need to be spotless
Flatten cardboard to fit in the pod
Never bag your recycling — place items loose in the bin
Large cardboard can go next to the bin on collection day
Batteries and electricals cause fires — take to collection points or HWRC
Check your collection schedule at birmingham.gov.uk

locations.name: Perry Barr Household Recycling Centre
locations.address: Wellhead Lane, Perry Barr, Birmingham B42 2FY
